definition: (of a liquid) to boil/(of sentiments etc) to boil over/to flare up/to be impassioned
to soar/to gallop/to prance/to turn over/to vacate/to clear
to be fired up (idiom)/to have one's blood racing
seething discontent (idiom); popular grievances boil over

sentences.english: It used to be that much of this discontent boiled under the surface.
sentences.chinese: 在過去，許多不滿情緒在社會表層下沸騰。
我是喬熱血沸騰的憤怒。

sentences.english: Water boiled up beneath the bubble, it seethed and spouted.
sentences.chinese: 球體下的海水沸騰起來，不停攪動，噴湧。

sentences.english: Add tomato puree, salt and 1 cup water; bring to a boil.
sentences.chinese: 加入番茄醬，鹽與1杯水，煮至沸騰。

sentences.english: An experimental study to investigate bubble detachment point in the sub-cooled boiling at low pressure and velocity is introduced.
sentences.chinese: 敘述了低壓低流速下過冷沸騰汽泡脫離點的試驗研究。

sentences.english: In his veins dances the blood of hero.
sentences.chinese: 他的血管裏沸騰着英雄的熱血。

sentences.english: A huge amount of experimental data is synthesized to establish a dimensionless number equation for intensified boiling heat transfer.
sentences.chinese: 並綜合大量實驗數據建立強化沸騰傳熱準數方程式。

sentences.english: Cook the sauce over a low heat until it boils and thickens.
sentences.chinese: 以小火加熱醬汁至其沸騰變濃。

sentences.english: The utility model relates to a zinc concentrate fluidized roaster.
sentences.chinese: 本實用新型涉及一種鋅精礦沸騰焙燒爐。

sentences.english: The news of Beijing successfully applied for Olympik Games mads us very excited.
sentences.chinese: 北京申請奧成功的消息令我們熱血沸騰。

sentences.english: The boiling soup subsides when the pot is taken off the heat.
sentences.chinese: 把鍋從爐子上端開時，湯就不再沸騰了。

sentences.english: We could hear the pot bubbling (away) quietly on the fire.
sentences.chinese: 我們能聽見壺裏的水在火上輕聲地沸騰着。

sentences.english: In the case of rimming steel, no or some deoxidation is carried out before casting.
sentences.chinese: 沸騰鋼在鑄錠前不脫氧或輕度脫氧。

sentences.english: You can also sterilise equipment by boiling it in water for at least 10 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 您也可以消毒設備由沸騰，它在水中至少10分鐘。

sentences.english: In medium saucepan over high heat, bring salted water to boil.
sentences.chinese: 取中號燉鍋配以高火，煮至鹽水沸騰。

definition: to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head
to pervade/to fill the air/diffuse/everywhere present/about to inundate (water)/permeated by (smoke)/filled with (dust)/to saturate (the air with fog, smoke etc)
